abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Municipal Solid
            Waste Management Project for Latvia was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was highly likely, the institutional
            development impact was substantial, and the Bank and
            borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons learned
            from the project: The rivalry between the two
            municipalities, the Riga City and the Stopinu Pagasts, was
            an impediment during Project preparation, and unfortunately
            continued during the first years of implementation. The
            appointment of management team by Riga City Council, could
            have been done in a more efficient way. Additional
            difficulty in the starting phase of the project was caused
            by differences between Latvian and Swedish detailed design
            standards, because the engineering consultant prepared the
            drawings in accordance with the latter.
